example[0]: I was driving along, thinking about Chris.
example[1]: a group of children walking along in a line
definition[1]: from one place on something such as a line, road, or edge towards the other end of it
example[2]: We were driving along Follyfoot Road.
example[3]: She glanced anxiously along the line of faces.
example[4]: He slid his hand along her arm.
definition[2]: forming a line beside something long
example[5]: The palm trees along the shore swayed in the wind.
example[6]: the toolbar along the top of your screen
example[7]: There were cheering crowds all along Pennsylvania Avenue.
definition[3]: a particular distance away, on or beside something long such as a line, road, edge etc
example[8]: Hugoâ€™s house was about two hundred yards away along the main street.
example[9]: The bathroom is just along  (=a short distance along) the corridor.
